<h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Shell Trading &amp; Supply (T&amp;S) Products organization is at the heart of Shells Downstream business.<\u002Fb><b> T&amp;S Products exists as the integrator with the rest of Shell PLC to enable stronger End 2 End value delivery.<\u002Fb><b> Low Carbon Fuels (LCF) is a new business within our Trading &amp; Supply Products organisation, established to enable the delivery of Shell<\u002Fb><b><\u002Fb><b>s low carbon fuels strategy in the context of Shells Energy Transition and road to Net Zero.<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> As a Regulatory Adviser you will have the opportunity to support understanding and execution of global regulatory and compliance efforts for all T&amp;S LCF North American. This includes Shells ethanol, biodiesel and renewable diesel, sustainable aviation fuel, feedstocks trading and supply business. As well as the Low Carbon Fuels (LCF) Sectors business that focus on decarbonizing many hard to abate areas including but not limited to aviation, maritime, mining and chemicals. Within this context, the role will primarily focus on Canada, monitoring both federal, state and provincial political and legislative landscape for opportunities and threats to our business and to then respond appropriately  usually through supporting the T&amp;S LCF teams developing their strategy and through external engagement and advocacy. <\u002Fb><b>As the business grows and the regulatory landscape becomes more complex you will be expected to support and drive the required changes, ensuring Shell plc can meet its energy transition aspirations as well as transportation renewables and GHG reduction obligations. <\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <ul>\n   <li><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Support the wider LCF team by providing analysis and insights into current and emerging regulatory requirements impacting feedstocks &amp; finished transportation fuels businesses in the short, medium, and long-term<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><\u002Fli>\n   <li><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Interpret and translate regulatory and legislative developments to advise T&amp;S on potential commercial impact to business. Support the development of plans to reduce risks or pursue opportunities by preparing material to engage traders, commercial leaders, and other senior stakeholders<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><\u002Fli>\n   <li><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Represent Shell externally regarding LCF related regulations and compliance with national, Provincial and state Regulators, industry bodies, and sustainability certification agencies as well as address any requests from Regulators<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><\u002Fli>\n   <li><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> In close collaboration with Government Relations, Policy and Advocacy as well as the relevant Shell plc businesses in Canada identify and formulate input to Shell plc overall LCF Advocacy Strategy both federally and by state\u002Fprovince across Canada<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><\u002Fli>\n   <li><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Research and communicate regulatory renewables\u002Fbiofuels compliance requirements for new business propositions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><\u002Fli>\n   <li><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Support Downstream businesses in the implementation of regulatory requirements resulting from either new regulations or changes to existing regulations that would impact Shells downstream business.<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><\u002Fli>\n   <li><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Expertise in regulations impacting low carbon fuels such as the Clean Fuels Regulation, CORSIA, Clean Air Act, Renewable Fuel Standard, Low Carbon Fuel Standard and Cap and Trade as well as other associated Regulations. In case no expertise in these specific Regulations candidate should demonstrate expertise in Regulations associated with other commoditized markets such as agricultural products, power, gas<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><\u002Fli>\n   <li><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Synthesize complicated regulatory requirements (current regulations and upcoming changes) into easy to digest training packs to ensure T&amp;S remains in compliance with the Canadian<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Skills &amp; Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <ul>\n   <li><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Minimum 5+ years of experience in a similar role; <\u002Fb><b>experience in regulatory discipline is a must<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><\u002Fli>\n   <li><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Bachelors Degree in any field of study<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><\u002Fli>\n   <li><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Expertise in regulations impacting low carbon fuels such as those listed above as well as any other Regulation with an indirect nexus with the aforementioned. In case no expertise in these specific Regulations the candidate should demonstrate expertise in similarly commoditized markets and\u002For Regulatory scopes preferably overlapping the low carbon fuels space<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><\u002Fli>\n   <li><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Strong attention to detail; Passion to analyze and understand laws, regulations, and energy and climate plans, and to communicate the legal framework to the business<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><\u002Fli>\n   <li><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Passion for Low Carbon Fuels, renewables space (within a commercial environment), and the energy transition<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><\u002Fli>\n   <li><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Stakeholder management skills - ability to nurture and leverage relationships is the key to success in this role which requires the management of multiple internal cross function and business relationships as well as a strong external focus.<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><\u002Fli>\n   <li><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Ability to respond confidently under time pressure to challenges<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><\u002Fli>\n   <li><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Highly motivated with self-starter mentality, strong team player<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><\u002Fli>\n   <li><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Strong interpersonal and communication skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><\u002Fli>\n   <li><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Languages in addition to English, French is very desirable<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><\u002Fli>\n   <li><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Candidate must be located in Calgary<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><\u002Fli>\n   <li><h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Must have legal authorization to work in the Canada on a full-time basis for anyone other than current employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>Supply chains are at the core of Shells competitiveness and C&amp;P plays an instrumental role in Shell achieving all three strategic ambitions. We work with 29,000 suppliers, collaborate with all the businesses and functions across the Group, and handle around $20-30 billion third-party spend. C&amp;P is an innovative, learning and compliant organization and by forging deep relationships with our business partners, we operate safe, competitive, sustainable and digitally connected global supply chains. In C&amp;P we believe in creating an inclusive culture and work environment where you can thrive, innovate and develop. Roles in Shales CP offer the opportunity to be part of a highly commercial environment with an emphasis on external focus and delivery of material value to the bottom line through delivering competitive, resilient supply chains - a real <b>C<\u002Fb>ommercial <b>P<\u002Fb>owerhouse.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This role will also manage the end-to-end execution of the Category Management &amp; Contracting Process (CMCP) for the Shales Assets in Canada. Collaborating with Internal stakeholders and suppliers to maximize value delivery in post and pre award phase while ensuring HSSE, Security of Supply, Operational and License to operate goals are achieved.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Accountabilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Proactively identify &amp; understand commercial\u002Fbusiness needs from internal stakeholders and collaboratively propose competitive solutions<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Develop commercially competitive and resilient contracting &amp; procurement strategies for assigned key spend categories which actively support the assets goals<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Conduct tenders and go to market approaches, evaluate bids &amp; drive negotiations with Suppliers<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensure delivery &amp; effectively manage contracts while continuously drive value improvement targets<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Identify, develop &amp; implement supply chain improvement opportunities<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensure Supply Chain Strategy supports Goal Zero Aspiration through implementation of fit for purpose Contractor Safety Management practices<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Manage Supplier Relationship effectively and collaboratively drive continuous performance improvement via relevant contract key metrics<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensure strong connect across the wider CP Organization (E.g.: Upstream, Downstream, Functions &amp; Technology, Production, Wells, Projects, Operations, LMMM, Centres of Excellence)<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Skills &amp; Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Minimum 5+ years of related role experience; Supply Chain experience<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Degree level (Business\u002FFinance\u002FEngineering\u002FLogistics\u002FEconomics) or proven long term comprehensive experience within CP<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Uncompromising on HSSE, ethics &amp; compliance is a must have in all CP<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Must have legal authorization to work in Canada on a full-time basis for anyone other than current employer<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>The Shell Brockville Lube Oil Blending Plant (LOBP) is located in Brockville, Ontario, Canada. Brockville is one of 40 LOBPs in Lubricants Supply Chain (LSC), falling under the Global Commercial class of business within Shell Downstream with a current throughput of approximately 130 ML\u002Fyr and capacity of 350 ML\u002Fyr, Brockville LOBP produces approximately 165 formulations of automotive, aviation and industrial lubricating oils across &gt;900 finished product SKUs. Products range across bulk rail and truck, 975L tote, 205L drum, 20L pail, 5L (gallon) and 1L (quart) small bottle. The plants 115 bulk storage tanks, 2 in-line blenders (ILB) and 2 auto-batch blending kettles (ABB) are fully automated with receiving, loading and packaging via the plant Distributed Control System with full ERP (GSAP) integration.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This exciting Shell role is accountable for the Small and Large Pack Production Operations and Warehouse operations at the Brockville LOBP. Beyond leadership of the Packaging &amp; Warehouse teams, the incumbent is a member of the Brockville Management Team and as such participates in the development and implementation of plant-wide policies, procedures and practices.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Packaging Production Manager will be responsible for leading the Packaging Production Team and Warehouse Team at the Brockville LOBP. The Packaging Operations Team consists of 17 people who deliver small pack (1 and 5 litre) and large pack (pails, drums and totes). The Warehouse is supported through a contractor and this role will require leadership and contract management of this team.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Packaging &amp; Warehouse Manager is critical in leading a team of highly knowledgeable staff, assuring they are setup to deliver and removing barriers to support them. The candidate will be part of the extended Brockville management Team and will work closely with the Brockville Plant Manager in delivering the site goals.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This role fully supports LSCs vision to drive Goal Zero HSSE performance by embedding a culture of caring for others, and mentoring employees as regards risk identification and mitigation. Team player with the ability to instruct, guide, develop and motivate others. Strong communication skills up, down, and across the organization.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Deliver Goal Zero and HSSE strategy creating a safe and reliable work environment for all staff, neighbors and community<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Utilize visible safety leadership to lead in HSSE<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensures Production resource levels and shifts are organized to enable Production Volumes to be achieved and the cost effective\u002Fefficient use of Overtime as needed to meet demand variability<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensures HSSE\u002Fsustainability strategies, systems, policies, standards, and tools are in place and functioning across Brockville LOBP<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Lead and inspire a team of 17 self-managed Packaging employees working collaboratively across all teams at Brockville LOBP<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Lead a community in the Warehouse with 1 direct report who oversees 25 3rd Party Logistics contractors to move the product through the Brockville Warehouse<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Contract Holder for the warehouse and responsible for the annual delivery of the budget<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensure quality product through rigorous application of the Lubricants Quality System (LQS) and compliance with ISO\u002FIATF standards. Apply continuous improvement principles to lead quality investigations and understanding source of the issue<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Drives performance tracking and analysis efforts, identifying trends\u002Fgaps relative to comparators, and translates them into operational targets and actions. (e.g., Run-rate charting, Equipment Uptime, Change-over time, etc.)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Deliver the Business Plan for Packaging production including total packaged. Hold team accountable and deliver on critical business performance KPIs including OPEX, line efficiency, production volume and quality<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Manage OPEX budget in Packaging Team through balancing work priority and overtime.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Develop and lead continuous improvement opportunities within plant operations.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Drive identification and completion in cost competitiveness and project delivery to sustain long-term reliability, growth and cost improvements for Brockville LOBP<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Deliver site strategy and vision as a member of the Brockville Leadership Team to create, communicate and lead the site<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Active member of the Brockville Emergency Response Team<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Skills &amp; Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Min 10 + years of related experience, preferably in the manufacturing, industrial or Oil &amp; Gas industry<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Previous experience leading a team with direct reports<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Knowledge of production operations is an asset<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Familiarity of ISO 9001\u002F14001\u002F45001 IATF 16949 an asset<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Must have legal authorization to work in Canada on a full-time basis for anyone other than current employer<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <div>\n   JOIN US IN POWERING CHANGE\n   <br> We are looking for graduates who share our purpose to power progress and our culture of inclusion, collaboration, and care. Well give you the support you need to forge your own path, and youll have real responsibilities and meaningful projects to work on right from the start.\n   <br> \n   <br> WHERE YOU FIT IN\n   <br> Shells purpose is to power progress together, by providing more and cleaner energy solutions. We believe that rising standards of living for a growing global population are likely to continue to drive demand for energy, including oil and gas, for years to come. At the same time, technology changes and the need to tackle climate change means there is a transition underway to a lower-carbon, multi-source energy system.\n   <br> \n   <br> As one of the worlds leading energy companies, Shell plays a key role in meeting the worlds growing energy demand in economically, environmentally, and socially responsible ways. There has never been a more exciting time to be part of the energy industry. Join us in our ambition to be a net-zero emissions energy business by 2050, and sooner if that is possible.\n   <br> \n   <br> Our world is exciting, dynamic and fast-moving. Energy plays a critical role in this. It keeps people moving, it takes us places and delivers products around the world. It's a key ingredient in countless things that we rely on every day, from building materials to the clothes on our backs.\n   <br> \n   <br> As populations grow and thrive, so does the need for more energy. But, this increasing demand is contributing to rising environmental pressures. We recognize the significance of climate change, along with the role energy plays in helping people achieve and maintain a good quality of life. A key role for society  and for Shell  is to find ways to provide much more energy with less carbon dioxide.\n   <br> \n   <br> Shell is a willing and able player in this transition. We continue to supply the world with natural gas - the cleanest burning hydrocarbon - to heat and light homes and power industry. We are investing in renewable energy like solar, wind and advanced bio fuels made from waste. We are exploring new ways of storing renewable energy. And we are developing digital products and services that help consumers and businesses use energy more efficiently, day in day out.\n   <br> \n   <br> WHATS THE ROLE?\n   <br> \n   <br> Our Graduate Programme is a rigorous development framework of specific competences, business-critical capabilities, and critical experiences that will enable you to become a competitive professional by the end of your 3-year programme.\n   <br> \n   <br> Right from the start, you will be given a challenging hands-on role, working in a diverse, global environment. You will be supervised and mentored with frequent reviews as part of a structured development programme. You will also be learning alongside brilliant people from all over the world, with the resources and support to explore new ways of thinking and working  all in all, an unbeatable experience.\n   <br> \n   <br> We know that learning is key to developing yourself both personally and professionally. The graduate programme encompasses a learning framework that includes internal and external courses, as well as on-the-job learning, designed to help you gain the skills you need to succeed.\n   <br> \n   <br> WHAT WE NEED FROM YOU\n   <br> You should enjoy being challenged, so that rather than being daunted or overwhelmed if a task seems impossible, you welcome the opportunity to be innovative. You also need to be good at absorbing information, analysing problems, making objective decisions, and coming up with original ideas. You should have the drive, and resilience to get things done, the flexibility to work well as part of a team and the credibility to influence others.\n   <br> \n   <br> We have multiple 2023 graduate opportunities in both the Commercial and Engineering streams.\n   <br> \n   <br> BUSINESS\u002FCOMMERCIAL:\n   <br> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You have three years or less of relevant work experience<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Your degree is in a Commerce or Business program such as General Business, Marketing, Supply Chain or Operations Management<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> By completing this application, you will be considered for any opportunities for which you are qualified. Opportunities for 2023 include Marketing Analyst, Sales Analyst, EPCM Analyst, Pricing Coordinator, Trading Analyst, Commercial Operator, Terminal Support Advisor and Channel Optimization Analyst.\n   <br> \n   <br> ENGINEERING:\n   <br> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You have three years or less of relevant work experience<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Your degree is in Engineering (Mechanical, Materials, Electrical, Process Automation, or Chemical)<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> By completing this application, you will be considered for any opportunities for which you are qualified. Current roles include Process EIT, Process Automation and Controls EIT, Machinery EIT, Static EIT, and Electrical EIT.\n   <br> \n   <br> Qualifications:\n   <br> \n   <ul>\n    <li>To be eligible for the Shell Graduate Program, you should be in your final year of study or have less than three years of relevant work experience<\u002Fli>\n    <li>You must have a minimum Cumulative GPA (CGPA) of 3.20.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>You must be legally entitled to work in Canada by way of Canadian Citizenship, Permanent Residency, or a valid work permit which would allow you to work for Shell<\u002Fli>\n    <li>If you are selected for a role that is considered safety-sensitive, you will be required to successfully complete a Medical and\u002For Alcohol &amp; Drug tests<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <br> By completing this application form, you will be considered for any opportunities for which you are qualified.\n   <br> \n   <br> Join the Shell Graduate Programme and Power Change from Day One.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Translated Company Description <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     JOIGNEZ-VOUS  NOUS POUR SUSCITER LE CHANGEMENT\n     <br> Nous recherchons des diplms qui, comme nous, souhaitent susciter le progrs et favoriser notre culture dinclusion, de collaboration et de bienveillance. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>Shell has an exciting opportunity for a Stakeholder Relations Advisor to join our Foothills team. In this role, you will be required to protect Shells license to operate, minimize stakeholder impacts, leverage opportunities, pursue strategic ambitions, and grow Shells reputation. You will work closely with key internal stakeholder as well as a broad set of external stakeholders to navigate a complex and dynamic external environment. As a Stakeholder Relations Advisor, you will act as a critical partner both internally and externally as Shell navigates a complex regulatory process<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will work alongside a team of people committed to one vision  driving integrated support and delivery. Whether its engaging with local communities or your Shell colleagues, your expertise and ability to listen and work effectively will help us effectively manage risks and realize opportunities.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Please Note - This is a 24 months fixed term contract.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> As the Stakeholders Relations Advisor, you will:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Support the implementation of a coordinated stakeholder engagement strategy (open houses, in person stakeholder engagements , participate in community organizations and develop proactive communications etc.)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Manage stakeholder grievances. Ensure records are maintained in Shells systems<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Deliver Public Consultation and Indigenous Consultation requirements<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support engagements for regulatory applications<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support delivery of Statement of Concern (SOC) responses if received<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Collaborate effectively with external corporate partners on stakeholder engagement and communications<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Manage the teams external Q&amp;A mailbox<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Skills &amp; Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Must have legal authorization to work in Canada on a full-time basis for anyone other than current employer<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Bachelors degree in Political Science, Environmental Management, Communication, Indigenous Studies or other related discipline Minimum of 7 years experience working in the energy industry or related field <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Community engagement experience and stakeholder relationship management skills<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Knowledge and understanding of the stakeholder and Indigenous landscape in Alberta<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience supporting an Alberta Energy Regulator (AER) Hearing process preferred, but not essential<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. POWERING CHANGE<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are looking for interns who share our purpose to power progress and our culture of inclusion, collaboration, and care. Well give you the support you need to forge your own path, and youll have real responsibilities and meaningful projects to work on right from the start.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> WHERE YOU FIT IN<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shells purpose is to power progress together, by providing more and cleaner energy solutions. We believe that rising standards of living for a growing global population are likely to continue to drive demand for energy, including oil and gas, for years to come. At the same time, technology changes and the need to tackle climate change means there is a transition underway to a lower-carbon, multi-source energy system.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> As one of the worlds leading energy companies, Shell plays a key role in meeting the worlds growing energy demand in economically, environmentally, and socially responsible ways. There has never been a more exciting time to be part of the energy industry. Join us in our ambition to be a net-zero emissions energy business by 2050, and sooner if that is possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> SHELL IN CANADA<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell has been proudly operating in Canada since 1911. Today, Shell Canada has over 3,100 employees across the county and operates 1,395 stations from coast to coast in addition to a refinery in Sarnia, ON and an expanding chemicals park in Fort Saskatchewan, AB (the Scotford Complex) <\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>We are excited to play a key role in the move to net-zero carbon emissions while providing the oil and gas needed by society for many decades to come.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> In Canada, we do everything from exploring for oil and gas, to refining and manufacturing, to discovering new ways to <b>reduce emissions<\u002Fb>, to delivering fuels to our customers from coast to coast.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> We have many successful businesses and <b>projects<\u002Fb> across Canada, including:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> a strong and rapidly growing Upstream business built around the Montney and the Duvernay shale plays, on a foundation of Foothills sour gas;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> a successful Downstream business anchored in our <b>Sarnia refinery<\u002Fb> (Ontario) and our <b>Scotford refinery<\u002Fb> and upgrader (Alberta) as well as our two world-class petrochemicals plants near Edmonton;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> a network of 1,300 retail sites across Canada  a vital point of connection for our customers to us  which makes us one of the pre-eminent fuel retailers in the country;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> strong Aviation, Sulphur and Lubricants businesses;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> an innovative Supply and Trading business;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> a prospective <b>LNG export project<\u002Fb> in Kitimat, B.C.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Canada is especially well-suited to offer lower carbon energy solutions thanks to our highly experienced workforce, our abundance of natural resources and supportive government policies. In Canada, Shell is actively exploring opportunities to invest in new fuels for transport, renewable power and customer solutions enabled by digital technology to lead the global movement towards cleaner energy.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> WHATS THE ROLE?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> An Assessed Internship is an excellent way to get to know Shell from the inside and immerse yourself in the energy industry. It can also help you decide what career path is right for you. Youll have full day-to-day involvement in actual projects, selected to match your interests and abilities.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Youll join a project team and work alongside Shell employees who are all professionals in their fields. Their perspectives will contribute to your understanding of our business, its demands, and rewards.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> A supervisor and mentor will support you directly and youll undertake regular assessments throughout your internship to ensure you get the most from the experience.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> As part of the Assessed Internship, youll have a formal mid-term review with your supervisor and mentor. At the close of your internship, you will be asked to prepare a presentation about your project and there will be discussion on project delivery and performance by your supervisor and mentor.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> An internship with Shell will provide you with:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> 4 to 16 months experience in your chosen business area<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> A real project with a significant level of business impact<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> An opportunity to discover which skills you would like to develop through constructive feedback and an opportunity to take on meaningful work<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> A chance to build and develop valuable networks and contracts for future career opportunities<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Our typical Grad Program opportunities within the commercial streams are in Calgary, AB and technical streams are in Fort Saskatchewan, AB and Sarnia, ON.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> WHAT WE NEED FROM YOU<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You should enjoy being challenged, so that rather than being daunted or overwhelmed if a task seems impossible, you welcome the opportunity to be innovative. You also need to be good at absorbing information, analysing problems, making objective decisions, and coming up with original ideas. You should have the drive, and resilience to get things done, the flexibility to work well as part of a team and the credibility to influence others.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are looking for ambitious students who are currently enrolled in a post-secondary institution and meet the following criteria:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Actively enrolled in a post secondar program in a Canadian university with least one more semester of education left following your internship<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> You must have a minimum Cumulative GPA (CGPA) of 3.20<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> You must be legally entitled to work in Canada by way of Canadian Citizenship, Permanent Residency, or a valid work permit which would allow you to work for Shell<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> If you are selected for a role in a safety-sensitive position, you will be required to successfully complete a Medical and\u002For Alcohol &amp; Drug tests<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Engineering Focused Opportunities:<br> You are actively enrolled in a Chemical or Electrical Engineering Program and will complete at least one more semester of education following your internship. Current roles include:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Process Engineering Intern<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Process Automation and Controls Engineering Intern<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Pressure Equipment Integrity (Mechanical\u002FMaterials) Engineering Intern<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Greenhouse Gas Modeling Engineering Intern<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Economics and Scheduling Analyst (Chemical) Engineering Intern<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Reliability and Machinery Engineering Intern<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Commercial\u002FBusiness Focused Opportunities:<\u002Fp>\n  <p> You are actively enrolled in a Business, Commerce or Supply Chain Program and will complete at least one more semester of education following your internship. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>The Americas Lubricants Marketing team is the ideal place for commercially minded strategic marketers with a passion for building brand value and delivering growth through priority sectors. Shell Lubricants is the leading global supplier of lubricants in the world and as a member of the marketing community, you will have the opportunity to be a part of a fun, diverse and exciting team shaping the future of mobility and operations.<br> <br> The lubricants industry is a dynamic, growing business on the cusp of change as we help our customers prepare for the energy transition. Our marketing team is responsible for setting the vision for each of the sectors we operate in and then executing our strategy through valued customers and partners throughout North America. You will be a part of a highly motivated marketing community committed to building strong brands, making data and insight-based decisions, and supporting each other for overall team success.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> As the Canada Marketing Analyst, you will support both the B2C Marketing Manager and B2B Marketing Manager in developing and executing both Consumer and Commercial Road sector strategies in Canada through both direct and indirect lubricants channels.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Manage B2B and B2C OEM marketing programs and promotions in alignment with the broader N.A. marketing strategy<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Responsible for a portion of the B2B and B2C marketing budget, including measurement of spend effectiveness to prioritize spend on highest return investments<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Execute the B2B social media strategy with a focus on LinkedIn to increase Lubricants thought leadership profile in Canada<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Develop the tradeshow and event strategy for Canada for B2B &amp; B2C, as a key lever for brand awareness and lead generation<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Act as Marketing Sustainability focal for Lubricants Canada, including educating sales teams on our sustainability CVPs and development of all customer communications and sales material<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Order and procure product tags, labels, decals and branded merchandise for customers and distributors<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Administer ad hoc customer and vendor payments through our 3rd party invoice payment vendor<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Create various product and services sales collateral, including brochures, sell sheets and presentations, working closely with sales, technical and creative teams<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Deploy monthly Distributor eNewsletter to keep our Distributors informed on national promotions, CVP and portfolio changes and market insights<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Manage lead generation activities through both external partners and internal stakeholders to support and improve the Sales Pipeline<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Accomplish the Amazon.ca account from marketing perspective and help to launch new products<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Progress various promotions and programs to enhance the sales CVP and differentiate from our competitors<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Conduct competitive reviews for the Canadian market, sharing insights with the broader team and leveraging these insights to improve our competitive offers<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support new product implementations, including gathering insights from sales on potential sales volume opportunity, development of collateral and training sales teams<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Manage content updates and enhancements to the website as the first brand impression for our customers and prospects, in order to improve thought leadership and optimize lead generation<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Skills &amp; Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Minimum 5 years experience in marketing, sales or relevant line of business<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Thorough understanding of the current lubricants market and its challenges would be a benefit, although not mandatory<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Proven track record of success in commercial business activities, sales or marketing<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Commercial mindset with strong business analytical and problem-solving skills<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Able to work independently and with limited supervision, highly self-motivated and able to effectively manage various competing priorities<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong project management and delivery track record<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Proven ability to manage multiple stakeholders, work with and influence diverse teams without direct authority<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Must have legal authorization to work in Canada on a full-time basis for anyone other than current employer<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>The Regulatory Operations team within Trading &amp; Supply is accountable for operationalizing and supporting optimization of the business activities built around the Renewable Fuel Standard (RFS), Clean Fuels Program (CFP) and Low Carbon Fuel Standard (LCFS) requirements. This includes credit inventory management, proactive aggregation, organizing and reporting of relevant data to the federal and state government agencies. The team works closely with various trading teams (Gasoline, Distillates, Ethanol and Biodiesel), Supply, and Manufacturing.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The team also works with various internal and external resources to ensure compliance with environmental regulations impacting our activities in the areas of imports, blending, distribution and exports of road-transportation fuels. Overall Trading &amp; Supply profitability and reputation can be materially affected by non-performance or inaccuracy.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Implement metrics to monitor reporting health (KPIs and KRIs)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Oversee the development and maintenance of desk procedures related to operator activities in the team<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Identify and escalate incidents and near-misses within team activities through CLE process<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Navigate complex regulatory landscapes with multiple internal &amp; external stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Creativity and ability to respond confidently under time pressure to challenges <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Demonstrate expertise in regulatory compliance and related operations with the capacity to monitor and upskill in a dynamic regulatory landscape<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Develop teams to work closely with associated desks to maintain commercial mindset<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Maintain ownership of risks: awareness, management, and reporting<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Cross train with LCF Process and Control Leads to implement operational excellence within team practices<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Focal for Canada Products Trading and Supply Leadership on regulatory reporting activities<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Daily activities to support credit trading<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support for business forecasting against mandate<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Counterparties  paperwork related to compliance (before report submission)<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Skills &amp; Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Minimum 5+ years of experience in a similar role; environmental and\u002For regulatory discipline<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Bachelors Degree in any field of study<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Must have legal authorization to work in the Canada on a full-time basis for anyone other than current employer<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>The Shell Scotford Chemicals and Energy Park is seeking a Non-Routine (NR) Scheduler. The NR Scheduler leads all aspects of Project\u002FMajor Maintenance scheduling for an assigned asset within the Scotford Maintenance, Construction, and Turnaround (MCTA) Scheduling department. The NR Scheduler is responsible for integrating all project specific plans into an integrated schedule.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The NR Scheduler engages with the Project Engineers, Project Planners, Area Execution Coordinators, and Execution Field Leads to ensure the plans are complete and that the plans developed are detailed enough to truly understand the work to be executed in the field. The NR Scheduler is accountable to build an executable schedule and understand the resource loading requirements for each discipline and activity to execute the plans effectively and productively.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Create an optimized, resource levelled, critical path schedule of work activities based on priorities, deferment opportunities, and available resources to ensure all schedules are fully resource loaded and levelled<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Enter and maintain the detailed job plan data (job steps, logic, resources, etc.) into scheduling tool, Primavera Enterprise-6, for each project and major maintenance schedule<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Collaborate with Planning and Execution teams to develop the work activities, the schedule logics, assign schedule resources, and conduct schedule analysis to provide a fully integrated project and\u002For major maintenance schedule, leading to the creation of the baseline schedule and its subsequent maintenance<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Liaise with Project Engineers and Execution to ensure proper understanding of the key schedule sensitivities and drivers<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Analysis of schedule logic, activity durations, constraints, float, resource loading, critical path(s) and resource levelling as needed to support project constraints<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Review scope change requests for the impact on schedules and the critical path of the project\u002Fmajor maintenance activity. Prepare reconciliation between earlier schedules and the current schedule<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Consolidate the impact of approved changes and any deviations from the key delivery targets and milestones, including productivity monitoring and \"What if scenarios\" to aid project management and execution decision-making<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Skills &amp; Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> 5+ years industry experience in Planning and\u002For Scheduling positions either for an EPC or operating company<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Advanced skill in Primavera application<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Basic knowledge of Project Controls systems, tools, and practices<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Education in a skilled trade or engineering is preferred but not required<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> If you don't see yourself fully reflected in every job requirement listed on the posting above, we still encourage you to reach out and apply. Research has shown that women and underrepresented groups often only apply when they feel 100% qualified. We are committed to creating a more equitable, inclusive and diverse company and we strongly encourage applicants of all genders, ages, ethnicities, cultures, abilities, sexual orientation, and life experiences to apply. At Shell we believe we are unique people, powerful together.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.- NOTER: de temps  autre, il arrive que nous modifions ou que nous retirions des emplois chez Shell et nous nous rservons le droit de le faire  tout moment, y compris avant la date limite indique. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>The Process Safety Engineer is responsible for all aspects of process safety for several operating units at the Sarnia Manufacturing Centre.The process safety engineer works closely with Operations, Engineering, Technology, and Maintenance personnel to address site process safety issues, review unit changes, facilitate process safety reviews, and support projects in their assigned unit.Finally, the process safety engineer serves as a site focal for key process safety management work processes.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Employees at the Sarnia Manufacturing Centre follow a hybrid work model, where employees work 3 days a week in the office with the option to work the remaining days of the week from home. Additionally, employees at Sarnia follow an alternative work schedule where employees receive every 3rd Friday off of work. <\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Accountabilities: <\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Provide day to day process safety support for units in their area of responsibility<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Serve as the process safety reviewer for changes in their area of responsibility<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Co-ordinate and participate in all process safety studies in their area of responsibility and facilitate some of these reviews. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Study, assess, and resolve long term process safety threats in their area of responsibility<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Acts as site subject matter expert for their assigned process safety management work process, which includes, attending network meetings, updating site procedures, and communicating to site personnel on work process changes<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Develop and implement tactics to improve their assigned work processes<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Potential on-call support for an Emergency Operations Center role<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Skills &amp; Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Minimum 7+ years of working experience in a related field; Refinery and chemical experience is a plus.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Minimum 3 years of experience in Process Safety.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Engineering degree in Chemical or Mechanical; Must have a P.Eng<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Knowledge of applying industry standards such as API, ASME, NFPA, CSA<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Familiarity with and industrial risk management tools (e.g. PHAPro, HAZOP, LOPA, consequence modelling) is an asset<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Must have legal authorization to work in Canada on a full-time basis for anyone other than current employer.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>The Shell Engineering Services team is seeking a Senior Instrumentation Engineer, Projects to join the team. The Engineering Services team is a multi-disciplinary team of engineers working to support the multi-disciplinary production teams. Engineering Services team members gain exposure from other disciplines to help round their experience and knowledge in the petrochemical industry.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Senior Instrumentation Engineer plays a key role in overall safety and reliability of the operating units at our Sarnia Manufacturing Centre. This team member provides technical advice, troubleshooting, assurance and start up assistance as required to the Reliability, Engineering, Execution, and Production Teams. They are also seen a technical leader and accountable for providing assurance and engineering support to capital projects.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Please Note: There is flexibility to work a hybrid schedule in this role if desired (2 days remote and 3 days from the manufacturing centre per week). <\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Responsibilities: <\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Provide technical assurance for instrumentation related to capital projects through the projects process<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support plans to replace instrumentation infrastructure through obsolescence<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Manage integration of instrumentation scopes with Production, Maintenance and Technical teams<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Provide technical assurance for instrumentation selection, installation, commissioning and start up<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensure technical recommendations reflect Statutory, Federal, and Provincial regulations, Shell standards, and reputable engineering practices<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Carry out causal failure analysis on all project related instrumentation failures<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Integrate equipment strategies through the Reliability Centered Maintenance (RCM) process<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Integration and review of management of change elements for instrumentation<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Pursue resolution of bad actors including integrating the investigations and recommending resolutions for bad actor instrumentation<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Provide technical assurance of preventive maintenance activities, pitstop, project and turnaround activities<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Skills &amp; Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Bachelors degree or Certificate in Engineering is required<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Minimum 10+ years of experience in a similar role<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Must be a Professional Engineer in the Province of Ontario or the ability to acquire<\u002Fli>\n   <li> In depth knowledge of the safe operation of different types of instrumentation and their application in the oil and gas processing industry<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Knowledge of Safety Instrumented Safety (SIS), Cause and Effect and Hazards, Effects, Management Process (HEMP)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Knowledge and skill in instrumentation practices and procedures, and appropriate codes<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Knowledge and practical experience with instrumentation and applications in the petrochemical industry.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Skilled in troubleshooting, coupled with an analytical approach to problem solving and decision making.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Knowledge and experience in Smart Plant Instrumentation (SPI)<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>The Project Development team provides the initial front-end development of improvement ideas and projects in support of the sites capital investment plan, including growth and energy transition projects. This Engineering role is essential to ensure quality front-end engineering work is completed that sets capital projects up for success by identifying innovative alternative solutions and scope development to minimize design rework later in the project. This position will challenge you to apply technical skills necessary to support project development with a range of process complexity, size, cost, and priority.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will be given the opportunity to learn new skills and broaden your network while integrating with key stakeholders and Shell networks as Shell embarks through its Powering Progress and energy transition journey. Joining the Project Development organization in Sarnia-Lambton will also present you with a chance to enjoy all that southern Ontario has to offer.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Please Note: This hybrid role needs to work effectively remotely and virtually within the sites hybrid working policy.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Accountabilities:<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Apply primary engineering and coordination skills to the development of capital investment ideas during the initial assessment, business case development, and conceptual design of proposed solutions<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Integrate and collaborate with key stakeholders to ensure alignment on project objectives and project deliverables<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Provide continued engineering support to the execution organizations (Projects and Maintenance) during the detailed engineering, procurement, and construction phases of the investment<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensure the appropriate technical assurance of the project designs via conformance to Shell Design &amp; Engineering Practice standards<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Generate and publish Scouting Reports at the end of Assess phase and lead all Engineering activities through the Assess phase to converge on a solution to the opportunity\\threat in question. Primary responsible party for delivering Assess phase within allocated time and budget<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Integrate with the Project Engineering for the Select phase to ensure more detailed front-end engineering work is completed including change management, concept selection, risk management and issuance of a basis for design document<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Lead special technical studies in the operating areas and providing engineering support to the assessment (pre-scouting) activities of the production teams. This position participates in all phases of the Project Work Process<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Responsible for project scope finalization phase include preparing and\u002For reviewing Engineering Flow Diagrams (EFDs), Utility Flow Diagrams (UFDs), Heat and Material balances, plot plans and supporting documents. This role coordinates the Safety Hazard Analysis (SHA) and safeguarding work<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Involved in performance test-runs and start-up reporting following the start-up of the project.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Rostered on-call support for an Emergency Operations Center Role<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Skills &amp; Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Minimum 5+ years of experience in the refining\u002Fpetrochemical industry<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Engineering degree in any discipline; Must have a P. Eng<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Background in discipline engineering support to operations and project experience required, broad range of process unit experience preferred<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience with plant changes and MOC a must, knowledge of safety reviews (PHA, HEMP-LOPA, etc.) with participation is a plus<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Must have legal authorization to work in Canada on a full-time basis for anyone other than current employer<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>Our Shell wells business operates within Alberta and British Columbia; most notably our Groundbirch asset in Fort St. John and our operations in Gold Creek in Grande Prairie. This operational scope includes one Drilling rig which drills 25-30 wells per year over 300 days in both the liquid rich and dry gas plays of the Montney. Completions comprises of approximately 100 days a year with well interventions making up approximately 150 operational days.<br> <br> The Wells team consists of both technical engineering and operational expertise delivering the portfolio from front end design through to execution. In total, the in the Wells team is accountable for approximately 150 million CAPEX.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Our wells team is currently seeking a <b>Drilling &amp; Completions Supervisor<\u002Fb> who will be responsible for the managing onsite operations across all three functions compromising of Drilling, Completions, and Well interventions. This is a field-based position which works a 2 week on and 2 weeks off rotation across various remote locations through Alberta and British Colombia. Ideal locations for this team member to reside in are Grand Prairie, Fort St. John, Wainwright, Calgary or Edmonton but other locations in either province are acceptable.<br> <br> Responsibilities for this Role include:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Act as a safety leader through championing the HSE tone and expectations for each location<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Lead all operations in a manner that ensures the health and safety of all personnel in parallel with the protection of the environment<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Lead all pre-tour safety meetings and participate in all 3rd party safety meetings and JSA discussions<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Responsible for the onsite participation and implementation of all safety policies and programs<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Maintain proper well control certification and be capable of managing well control situations<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Identify and assess HSE and operational risks and develop contingency plans to mitigate same<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensure work plans are communicated to and understood by all affected personnel<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensure operations comply with all statutory, policy and program requirements<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensure all regulatory approvals are in place prior to any operations taking place<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Continuously identify ways to reduce cost and improve work program effectiveness without sacrificing quality, production rates or reserves<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Communicate daily with the Wells Engineer to continuously improve well planning and execution<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Maintain direct and timely communication with the Field Wells Superintendent and Wells Superintendent<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Investigate, follow up and ensure all incidents relating to rig site personnel, equipment and procedures are closed out<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Monitor, evaluate and regularly report on overall performance against program and performance of the services and equipment involved in the operation<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensure <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>Shell Scotford is located approximately 40 km from Edmonton Alberta, Canada. The site consists of an Upgrader that processes bitumen from the Albian Oil Sands facility in Fort McMurray as part of our Joint Venture agreement, a Refinery unit that converts vacuum gas oils and light hydrocarbon streams produced by the upgrader and a Chemicals facility comprised of a Mono-Ethylene Glycol (MEG) plant and an Ethylbenzene and Styrene Monomer (EBSM) plant. Scotford is also home to Quest, an integrated carbon capture and storage facility.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The site Projects Group consists of a multi discipline team of project development and project engineering professionals that work together to deliver a site wide portfolio of small capital projects with individual project headline sizes less than $50 million CAD for the Scotford Upgrader, Refinery and Chemicals plants.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Our Projects Group is currently seeking a <b>Project Engineer<\u002Fb> who will be responsible for managing projects within this portfolio though using the Shell Opportunity Realization Work Process.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Responsibilities for this role include:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Lead all projects through the project definition, detailed design phase, execution phase to project close-out<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Manage cost, schedule, resource planning, contracting, procurement, detailed design review facilitation, and development of the required team culture in support of achieving project goals<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Lead multi-discipline projects through developing a strong understanding of project needs and interfacing with technical disciplines that may be outside of core competencies<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Assess and effectively manage project and technical risk in conjunction with the Production Area Teams<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Interface with production and maintenance planning teams to plan and deliver a quality start-up in a brownfield setting, managing the operations readiness, completions and commissioning and start-up aspects of the project to asset Transition phase<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Interface closely with EPC companies to complete project engineering requirements based on the phase of the project<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Champion overall safety, quality, costs, schedule, and delivery of the agreed to scope for assigned projects<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Simultaneously manage multiple projects as various stages of execution<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Make many key decisions relating to project scope and execution within short timeframes<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Understand and comply with process safety risk reduction concepts, properly applying Shell Design Engineering Practices, Shell work processes and industry standards<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Influence colleagues and stakeholders with different priorities in order to maintain project schedule<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Collaborate with team members while build effective relationships with colleagues and stakeholders all levels of the organization<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Skills and Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Must be eligible to work for any employer in Canada without sponsorship<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Must have a bachelors degree or diploma in Engineering or Technology, preferably in control systems, chemical, mechanical or instrumentation engineering discipline<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Possess a P.Eng or P.L.Eng or must be eligible for accreditation with APEGA in either a Professional Engineering or Professional Licensee capacity<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Minimum 10 years experience preferably in project management or a combination of project management and discipline engineering<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience working with new digital platforms, protype communication technology and advanced construction\u002Ffabrication methods<\u002Fli>\n   <li> PMP or APMQ certification is preferred<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience with SAP and Primavera is preferred<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience working with Contract negotiation and Procurement would be an asset<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Continuous Improvement and Process Improvement experience would be an asset<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b><i>What's the role - <\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Trading &amp; Supply (T&amp;S) is at the heart of Shell's Downstream business. T&amp;S has the primary responsibility of managing and optimizing the physical supply chain. Our goal is to deliver the right product to the right place on time while maximizing the overall margin for Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> The T&amp;S Supervisor is responsible for leading the eastern or western commercial operations team, who implement, schedule and execute product and bio-fuel movements.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Supervisor coaches the Commercial Operators to ensure T&amp;S commitments are optimized to drive maximum value through solid commercial acumen and logistics expertise.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> The successful candidate will provide leadership beyond their primary responsibility by identifying and championing integrated margin opportunities across the Downstream.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Key accountabilities of the Supervisor, Trading &amp; Supply Operations include:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Lead a team of 7-10 direct reports to effectively schedule and execute product and biofuels movements to meet demand, inventory and contractual obligations.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Coach Commercial Operators on developing and applying commercial acumen and ensuring they are seeking to add value by exercising commercial and logistical optionality to maximize Shell profitability.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensure operation activities related to moving products and bio-fuels meet HSSE, product quality, local regulatory and compliance requirements.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Maximize value by optimizing delivery costs and effective utilization of supply chain resources.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Act as focal point and key resource in handling local Emergency response, business continuity and incident reporting.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Deliver operational excellence by meeting primary transport operating budget, minimizing costs, stock outs and product quality incidents. Achieve hydrocarbon management operational KPIs and monitor of business and financial controls.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensure all contractual obligations are carried out and comply with all necessary requirements. Monitor execution to optimize timing and contract options to minimize risk and exposure while maximizing value capture.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Act as Contract Owner or Contract Holder for logistics contracts with massive means transporters, 3rd party depots and service providers (e.g. inspectors, surveyors); contribute to HSSE audits and assure contract compliance in operational matters.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> The Eastern Supervisor acts as Canadian Marine Operations focal and while the Western Supervisor acts as the Rail Operations focal, overseeing the value delivery, communication and alignment of the business.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Contribute to development of massive means transport strategies, supply contracts and identifies operations improvement opportunities.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Motivate and develop the team members in achieving functional operational excellence including required HSSE and PQ management competencies.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Provide back-up coverage for T&amp;S Coordinator and ensure appropriate back-up coverage is in place to smoothly manage operations.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><i> What we need from you  <\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>This is a team lead role within T&amp;S Commercial Operations, Products. The department has 28 members, is very operational and provides 24\u002F7 support to our manufacturing and marketing partners. We are interested in candidates who can build on our business vision, are prepared to accept accountability and can achieve great results through teamwork.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Must have a legal authorization to work in Canada on a full-time basis for anyone other than current employer.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Bachelor or Master of Engineering\u002FScience Engineering\u002F Business degree preferred<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Minimum of ten 10 years related experience with a strong knowledge base and understanding of Downstream business.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Handle competing priorities, tight timelines and make decisions amidst ambiguity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Understand key elements of supply chain and operations, scheduling and transportation and execution of contracts.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Proven commercial mindset and ability to identify integrated value.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to build and lead an effective team. Keen interest in coaching and developing others.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Effective interpersonal skills, strong communication and influencing abilities to build cross-organizational support and strong working relationships.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Manage and develop 3rd party relationships (e.g. partners and logistic providers) and represent Shell in industry.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong team player and leader with a proven drive to deliver performance expectations.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Fluency in both English and French would be asset.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>The Process Control Network (PCN) Specialist provides engineering support, troubleshooting, and maintenance of Shell Scotfords Process Control (Operations Technology\u002FOT) network systems. This includes short-term and long-term activities that deliver a Highly Secure, High Availability Process Control Network, in full compliance with Shells Risk Profile in the 5 Process Control Domain (PCD) activities of Identify, Protect, Detect, Respond and Recover. The PCN Specialist also works closely with Automation System Specialists, bringing their networking skills to the table, in the hands-on technical support and maintenance of digital systems, computer and electronic systems, and communications systems within the site.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The following are the primary accountabilities for the Process Control Network Specialist:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Perform proactive technical monitoring of the Scotford Site Process Control Network, identifying threats to security and reliability, and actively responding to system issues.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Provide technical support for the management of the secure network infrastructure including firewall configuration, rule review, network segmentation, maintenance, and upgrades.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Manage and maintain Scotfords virtual infrastructure (Hyper V, VMWare) including adding new host servers, building\u002Fmaintaining VMs (Virtual Machines), and maintaining secure backups.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Contribute to network designs for new projects, assuring Shells cyber security and PCD standards are followed. Support project execution with hardware installation and configuration.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Carry out assurance activities supporting Shells Process Control Domain Integrity (PCD-I) work process and participate in external audit activities as a technical resource.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Collaborate with system specialists, vendor contractors, and other departments to securely progress Scotfords digitalization and transformation journey.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Skills &amp; Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><i> What do we need from You? <\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>You must have legal authorization to work in Canada on a full-time basis for anyone, not just your current employer.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> You have completed a post-secondary degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or an equivalent Engineering Technology diploma.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> You have designed, implemented, and maintained a highly secure, high-reliability network, and have developed a solid foundation in IT\u002FOT security fundamentals.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> You have demonstrated your knowledge of virtual system management by building and maintaining Hyper-V or VMWare virtual systems.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> You have demonstrated your skills as a Network Administrator in many of the following areas: Windows Servers, enterprise anti-virus, endpoint security, SIEM, logging configurations, IDS\u002FIPS, authentication methods, TCP\u002FIP, packet capture, and analysis, WSUS.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> You have shown yourself knowledgeable in networking fundamentals, including switching, routing, firewall management, IPSec\u002FVPN tunnels, and encryption. If you have experience with Cisco and Palo Alto, even better!<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ideally (But not necessary) you have worked in a large industrial plant environment and are familiar with industrial work processes such as Management of Change (MOC)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> You are willing to provide some off-hours support during plant upsets, emergencies, and Turnarounds. These events are not typically a regular occurrence however they do require additional support when they happen.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> You bring a learner mindset, and a collaborative way of working to the team<\u002Fli>\n   <li> You will bring your unique perspective, views and ideas to support the transformation of our business<\u002Fli>\n   <li> You will follow Shells Respectful Workplace Policy and conduct yourself in manner that is inclusive and supportive<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>The Sarnia Manufacturing Centre (SMC) is looking for a new team member to join as a Unit Inspector. As a member of the Pressure Equipment Integrity Team, the successful candidate will have an important role to play in ensuring the integrity of stationary equipment at the site.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Familiarity with typical refining equipment and processes as well as a good understanding of degradation mechanisms, fabrication methods, protective coatings as well as industry codes and standards will enable the Inspector to provide sound guidance to the site for equipment monitoring, repair or replacement requirements.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Unit Inspectors are certified in API-510 and API-570 as a minimum, with additional training and certification as identified by organizational needs in conjunction with this team members individual development plan and goals.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Accountabilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Monitor the overall condition and compliance of pressure vessels, piping systems, relief valves and safeguarding check valves at the Sarnia Manufacturing Centre to ensure compliance to all applicable codes and standards as well as clear communication of threats to availability<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Develop and communicate Equipment Integrity scope into the site maintenance programs<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Provide Quality Assurance for third party fabrication vendors working on SMC pressure equipment<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Interact closely with jurisdictional (TSSA) legislative branch personnel and their representatives<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Utilize opportunities to incorporate new inspection technologies and leverage new resources at the site<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Skills and Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Successful completion of a Technologist Diploma Program in Welding Engineering Technology, Mechanical Engineering Technology, Chemical Engineering Technology, or equivalent is preferred but other education and experience will also be considered<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Five years of Quality Assurance, Quality Control or Asset Integrity experience at petrochemical or other similar industrial sites<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Successful completion of API-510 and API-570 is preferred<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Awareness of NDE techniques, welding, coatings, refractory, cathodic protection<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Knowledge in typical industry degradation mechanisms and their mitigation<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Skill in application of all applicable pressure vessel and piping standards (ASME, API, NACE, etc.) and associated legislative requirements<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Knowledge and Understanding of Power Boiler inspection and maintenance as well as associated legislative codes and standards will be considered an asset<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Company Description <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <h3
