<h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>The Shell Scotford Chemicals and Energy Park is seeking a Facilities Scheduler. The Facilities Scheduler implements the scheduling function for Routine Maintenance for Non-Production Unit departments, specifically Real Estate. The purpose of the Facilities Scheduler role is to ensure timely execution of maintenance work and minimize cost of execution through optimized resource utilization by scheduling both the Corrective and Preventive work. This is done by publishing an agreed upon frozen schedule, which is created by selecting work orders by priority, need date, and resource availability.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Create an optimized, resource levelled, critical path schedule of work activities based on priorities, deferment opportunities, and available resources to ensure all schedules are fully resource loaded and levelled<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Schedule both Corrective and Preventative maintenance work, complying with agreed completion dates and resolving conflicts by reallocation and \u002F or shifting of tasks in collaboration with stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Maintain a clear overview of the volume of prepared corrective\u002Fpreventive backlog work orders as well as their priorities to decide when to bring the work into the schedule for execution<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Combine activities for efficient execution, reducing losses in required time for work preparation, work execution and work closure<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Skills &amp; Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> 5+ years refinery or petrochemical facility scheduling experience<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to work within systems such as SAP<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Proficient in Primavera and Impress<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience in PowerBI development is an asset<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to work in Microsoft applications<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Education in a skilled trade or engineering is preferred but not required<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> If you don't see yourself fully reflected in every job requirement listed on the posting above, we still encourage you to reach out and apply. Research has shown that women and underrepresented groups often only apply when they feel 100% qualified. We are committed to creating a more equitable, inclusive and diverse company and we strongly encourage applicants of all genders, ages, ethnicities, cultures, abilities, sexual orientation, and life experiences to apply. At Shell we believe we are unique people, powerful together.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>Lead the team tasked with ongoing development and support implementation of Loyalty &amp; CRM Programs, consistent with Retail CVP. Deliver the Loyalty Program strategy that integrates into the broader Marketing strategy for now and future. Interface with other Marketing and Mobility functions to ensure strategic alignment and active usage of Loyalty programs as key strategic lever to deliver business and customer goals. Work closely with external partners like Loyalty Ventures and CAA to ensure Loyalty Programs are healthy, robust and profitable. Define and develop relevant talent pool and skills required to manage Loyalty Programs in a professional way. Act as key ambassador for promoting customer centricity and focus on Best Customer while retaining and activating Shell's customers profitably.<br> <br> Develop a robust and compelling Loyalty &amp; CRM strategy for Canadian retail to differentiate and grow Shells Mobility business, Lead the development of cross-functional Loyalty strategies in support to Fuels, B2B, B2C and Convenience Retail ,Support the leadership development of new Loyalty applications including partner alliances, Own and manage multi-million dollar 3rd party contracts for suppliers such as Loyalty Ventures.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Collaborate with Marketing Technology and IT to ensure the technology infrastructure for Loyalty program delivery is fit-for-purpose and supports growth objectives. Develop and implement strategic ways to monetize, improve and leverage Shell retail consumer information and segmentation properties. Deliver Fuels and Convenience Retail plan through effective database management and offer development leveraging the AIR MILES Rewards program.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><br> Note: Our preference is for this position to be based in Calgary but we are open to having the role work remotely anywhere in Canada.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Responsibilities:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Lead the development of cross-functional Loyalty strategies in support to Fuels, B2B, B2C and Convenience Retail<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support the leadership development of new Loyalty applications including partner alliances<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Own and manage multi-million dollar 3rd party contracts for suppliers such as Loyalty One<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Collaborate with Marketing Technology and IT to ensure the technology infrastructure for Loyalty program delivery is fit-for-purpose and supports growth objectives<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Develop and implement strategic ways to monetize, improve and leverage Shell retail consumer information and segmentation properties<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Deliver Fuels and Convenience Retail plan through effective database management and offer development leveraging the AIR MILES Rewards program<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Skills &amp; Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><i> What we need from you  <\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Bachelors Degree; MBA preferred<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Minimum 8+ years in management loyalty programs<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Minimum 5+ years in leadership roles<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Must have legal authorization to work in Canada on a full-time basis for anyone other than current employer<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>The world is changing-fast, and Shell is changing, too  not only to keep up with the external pace, but also to anticipate and shape a different future. The integrated Corporate Relations function delivers value by supporting our Shell strategy to bring the outside in and secure and drive Shells reputation and values.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Drawing on a strong base of professional excellence, we aspire to be best-in-class at achieving integrated outcomes through effective engagement, communication, and impact management with external and internal stakeholders.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Our overall objective of Social Investment is to deliver tangible benefits to communities, help bridge opportunity gaps and support an inclusive energy transition to strengthen our societal license to operate and achieve our Shell Canada and Powering Progress strategies. If you are passionate about these things, this role will be your chance to influence Shell Canadas Social Investment delivery at a national strategic level.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This Social Investment Advisor role is focused on national social investment strategy and delivery, strategic engagement and stakeholder management, and outcome measurement and reporting. The role is within the Corporate Relations function on the Corporate and Internal Communications team responsible for country level reputation and engagement.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Accountabilities: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Launch and manage Shell Canadas refreshed Social Investment (SI) Strategy<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Update and oversee the Shell Canada Disaster Response Plan<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Work with global SI network, Shell Canada Social Performance and Indigenous Relations managers, and Corporate Relations asset focals to ensure aligned approaches and plans<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Stakeholder management with country level SI partners and represent SI thought-leadership on behalf of Shell Canada externally<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support country level strategic sponsorships working with Corporate Relations, Reputation and Campaigns Advisor<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Manage SI ethics and compliance, payments, budgets, and reporting requirements<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Communicate SI strategy, milestones, outcomes etc. through internal and external communications including web, social media, feature articles and intranet<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Evaluate opportunities (including managing and responding to ongoing SI requests), lead contract negotiations, and execute brand management activities for social investments and sponsorship campaigns and programs<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Additional support for Shell Canada Corporate and Internal Communications teams as required<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Skills &amp; <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>Shell is looking for a Benefits Advisor who is a strategic thinker with a passion for operational excellence. This is not a typical benefit role, rather, it is a strategic role with the opportunity to make real impact in shaping benefits and policy for the future. You will have the opportunity to grow your career by working globally and locally to ensure our Policies and Benefits are fit for purpose and aligned with our global intent. As a member of the Country Policy and Benefits team, you will play a key role in assuring and safeguarding our License to Operate within the Country.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will be accountable to ensure our benefits are grounded in and aligned with our global identity and company values. You will also play a key role in providing a great user experience for our employees and leaders by ensuring our policies are clear, easy to access and apply; and that they are easy and cost-efficient to administer with the support of our HR Operations teams. As the Subject Matter Expert (SME) you will hone your skills by providing insights, and staying current on legislative requirements, best practices, and applications across all businesses. If all these sounds like you and you are keen on taking the next step in your career, then we would love to hear from you.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This position requires a Hybrid working setup with the expectation to work one or two days in the office.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Accountabilities:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Act as a proactive, strategic partner to the broader HR Community and business to solve business challenges within benefit remit<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Contribute to Global Policy and archetype development (e.g. leaves); as a project team member and\u002For provide local legislative insights, analysis, and benchmarking in order to input into the overall development<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support the rollout of global policies, archetypes, and continuous improvement initiatives including providing local insights and requirements, developing change and engage plans, and supporting leader\u002FHR engagements<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Develop and implement modern and competitive benefits programs, including clear policies and procedures to optimize the employee experience<\u002Fli>\n   <li> In partnership with Occupational Health, continuing to advance the wellness agenda with the integration of employee trends and leading-edge external best practices<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Lead large project management activities including change, engage, and communications to HR, leaders, and employees<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Resolve challenges and complex cases as an escalation point for queries and complaints<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Responsible for developing and providing subject matter expertise relating to benefits policies<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Actively seek out and embed external best practices into Canada benefits and wellness programs<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Responsible for the development, administration, and communication of the Shell Canada benefit programs for employees and retirees and alignment with the companys rewards philosophy<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Liaise with ER\u002FIR, Shell Legal, D&amp;I, HR Advice, HRBPs, etc. on policy and benefit-related activities<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Provide expertise to the HR Country Manager, P&amp;B Manager, and ER\u002FIR Manager on local benefits topics for renewal or negotiations of CBAs, in order to enable competitive and affordable positioning<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Skills &amp; Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Minimum of 10 years of related work experience<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Degree in Human Resources or equivalent<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Must have legal authorization to work in Canada on a full-time basis for anyone other than the current employer<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b><i>What's the role - <\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Trading and Supply (T&amp;S) is at the heart of Shell's Downstream business. T&amp;S has the primary responsibility of managing and optimizing the physical supply chain. Our goal is to deliver the right product to the right place on time while maximizing the overall margin for Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> T&amp;S brings Shells Trading, Supply &amp; Distribution, and Commercial Fuels in Argentina, Canada, Singapore and the Rhine into one fully integrated business designed to create and capture end-to-end value for Downstream. The position is one of 30 positions within Trading &amp; Supply Commercial Operations Products Team. Together the team is responsible for managing the physical delivery of product movements across Canada.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Operations team works closely with the Channel Optimizer, Product Quality and Trading teams (e.g. Gasoline, Distillates, Low Carbon Fuel) to help optimize overall profitability through its commercial acumen and expertise in blending, scheduling and refinery operations.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Key Dimensions:<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Systems<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> GSAP Super User. Provide guidance and support to the schedulers when using Sap in different modules, troubleshooting of issues, raise tickets for errors to IT, PGS focal, act as liaison with other business offshore when issues arise.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Focal for Master Reference Data (MRD) set up requests for new plant locations and GSAP new configuration related with TSW module.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Focal for Month end activities impacting the schedulers process (Support Accrual process, Closing Nominations,<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Systems support (monthly Terminal Outage reporting, SCT (Supply contract tool) raise tickets to correct data errors when required)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Lead for New Business Scenarios Operations related with Supply, support for other New Business Scenarios (be a Lead coordinating changes in processes and systems when new business scenarios arise impacting Supply)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Focal for Terminal Cockpit. Super user for Scheduler in using new tool for reporting and entering outages.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Analysis<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Monitor agreements (performance monitoring, liaise with Finance for reconciliation, raising awareness to coordinator)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Lead Primary Transport budget, do the analysis and lookback (update and communicate BPA every month and coordinate Yearly budget exercise)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Extract and analyzes data GSAP and Data warehouse tools) for reporting when required<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p> Other:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Vacation coverage to schedulers desks<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support SAP Nomination process with SRR team and schedulers.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><i> What we need from you - <\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Must have a legal authorization to work in Canada on a full-time basis for anyone other than current employer.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> At least three (3) years work experience with managing systems (GSAP TSW and HM modules, GSAP BI report tools, SCT, TOR, Excel, Sharepoint)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Analytical skills<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Priorities management<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Adaptation<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Communication and interpersonal skills<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Relevant experiences in any supply, distribution, or trading operations.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This is an operational job that requires incumbent to be contactable outside office hours to oversee important activities or resolve unplanned operational issues. In addition during the year there are times when the incumbent will need to complete time sensitive month end activities on statutory holidays (e.g. Canada Day). Time in lieu will be provided to compensate.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Trading and Supply works 3 days per week in the office (Wednesday, Thursday and one day per employees choice)<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>The Soil and Groundwater Solutions (SGWS) Senior Program Manager is responsible for safely managing environmental liabilities and delivering the SGWS Sustainable Risk Management program for all businesses within assignment area. Project portfolio may include multiple Classes of Business (CoBs) across multiple provinces and regulatory regimes. The role is virtual and may be located across Canada. The preference is for this team member to live in Calgary or Edmonton where Shell has operations, but there is flexibility for this team member to reside anywhere in Canada. <\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Accountabilities: <\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Develop risk management strategies for reducing soil and groundwater environmental liability in a portfolio across multiple CoBs such as Post Closing Rights and Obligation (PCRO), Mobility, Distribution, New Energies, Upstream including complex environmental projects, sites in litigation and multi-party sites<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Manage projects across multiple provinces ranging from initial environmental site assessment through remedial action planning, implementation, reclamation and regulatory closure<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Lead development and management of relationships with both internal and external stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Drive Goal Zero performance culture with environmental consultants and their subcontractors using Learner Mindset, Human Performance, and other approaches <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Drive replication of best practices and identification of continuous improvements for managing SGWS projects across portfolio<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Oversee and ensure proper implementation of the Environmental Procedures Manual<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensure that Shell environmental standards are met on all projects<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Develop and maintain relationships with internal business stakeholders for applicable CoBs within portfolio<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Manage financial approvals and spend with environmental consultants to ensure compliance<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Coordinate provincial advocacy efforts to influence regulations, support development and approval of sustainable risk-based approaches<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Skills &amp; Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Minimum 15+ years of soil and groundwater assessment, remediation experience in a similar role<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Upstream soil and groundwater experience is necessary, Western Canadian experience preferred Experience in Project Management of soil and groundwater assessment, remediation and risk liability management projects is required<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Bachelors Degree in Engineering or Science is preferred with a focus in geology, hydrogeology, or another related Engineering discipline<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Approximately 10% to 25% travel will be required throughout western Canada<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Must have legal authorization to work in Canada on a full-time basis for anyone other than current employer<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Description du poste<br> Lquipe de Shell Engineering Services est  la recherche dun ingnieur principal en instrumentation, Projets pour se joindre  lquipe. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <p>In the Shell Safety Environment and Asset Management (SEAM) team, our aspiration is for excellence in supporting assets to safely deliver their Fit for the Future aspirations. The SEAM team is currently seeking a Regional Turnaround Assurance Manager to providing turnaround assurance and support to operating assets in their respective region. This includes a regional accountability for turnaround performance and skill pool health. <\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Accountabilities:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Assist the asset turnaround leadership team to understand their gap to potential and provide technical expertise and insight to enable turnaround teams to build and deliver effective improvement plans to achieve the desired performance <\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p>Partner with other maintenance, reliability and turnaround leads to maintain a connected community of turnaround practitioners through the Shell Asset Management System networks that includes the sharing of recommended practices and the fast replication of improvements within the region<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Work with the asset team to set the appropriate turnaround event assurance plans and build these into the service plan for the asset\u002Fregion ensuring activities are planned and resourced<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Providing support, upon request, for the implementation of the Shell Perform Turnarounds Standard, Manual, and recommended practices through deployment of both process as well as technical and discipline support<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Deliver turnaround event Assurance activities as defined by the event assurance plans<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support\u002Fco-deliver other work process assurance reviews as required<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Partner with Shell Asset Support Managers, Excellence Leads, other support groups and 3rd Parties to drive performance improvement, provide input\u002Fsupport to the Asset Business Planning process<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide turnaround operations excellence and flawless expertise towards integrated turnaround delivery<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Champion turnaround operations through best practice sharing in the region and across regions<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Advocate use of available technology and tools in the Global Technology Catalogue to reduce safety risk, cost, and schedule of Maintenance and\u002For Turnaround activities. Providing coaching and mentoring support for regional SPO, SPFP and Turnaround practitioners.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support the Shell Global Discipline Head (GDH) in identifying suitable focal points and turnaround practitioners in the asset by helping to validate the required competencies for the role. <\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p>Work with functional leads and discipline heads to support the Operating Assets to develop &amp; maintain capability and capacity to execute the Perform Turnarounds Standard, Manual and Recommended Practices.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Facilitate learning from involved expertise, including 3rd parties, to improve assurance quality. <\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p>Championing the use of technology applications to improve competitive position Safer, Fewer, Faster and Cheaper<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Skills &amp; <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>Royal Dutch Shell is currently seeking a Commercial Scheduler, to join our Commercial Operations Fuel Oil Team. This team is responsible for managing the physical delivery of Shells domestic and international movements of Fuel Oil. The team of commercial operators work within the Fuel Oil North America Trading Team, to optimize overall profitability through its commercial acumen and expertise in blending, scheduling and refinery operations. In delivering its value to the Shell organization, the team engages with the many internal and external customers in the fuel oil supply chain.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><br> The company seeks to attract a Commercial Scheduler with strong technical, analytical, and commercial skills. Demonstrated teamwork, resilience, and ability to collaborate well with other team members, groups and businesses is key. This is a complex and dynamic part of the trading business and, as such, this is a high profile and demanding role suitable for a highly motivated candidate. Candidates with future interests in commodity trading and commercial negotiations are encouraged to apply.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Responsibilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Schedule and optimize the monthly supply plan for incoming refined products by rail, vessels, and pipeline meet demands for fuel oil<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Execute the supply activities by ensuring product quality handling is consistent with local requirements as well as Shell HSSE and Product Quality standards in a cost effective and efficient manner for the assigned region<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Deliver Operation Excellence and create commercial value through meeting and optimizing logistics\u002Ftransport operating budgets<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Focus on optimizing demurrage targets by effectively communicating and interfacing with appropriate teams<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Meet service levels and minimize runouts &amp; product quality incidents<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Manage supplier partnerships and relations<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Demonstrate continuous improvement mindset though challenging norms and always striving for ways to improve existing processes<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Apply commercial understanding of the business and seek to add value by exercising commercial and logistic options<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Skills &amp; Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Must have legal authorization to work in Canada on a full-time basis for anyone other than current employer<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Bachelor's degree or MBA in Finance, Accounting, Supply Chain or Engineering<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Minimum three (3) years of work experience preferably within a large Oil and Gas, Midstream or Trading Organization<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Advanced Excel. (Macros\u002FSolver\u002FDatabase Management)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Possess knowledge in commodity measurement \u002F API standards, HSSE and commodity operations.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Lead or support the month end process for reporting production volumes and inventories in systems and for group to reconcile gaps.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Knowledge of Endur and QlikView is a plus<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. The Key Account Manager role is part of the Canadian sales team and will be responsible for acquiring, managing, and growing a portfolio of fleet customers across all provinces. Targeted fleet customers are from a variety of industries sectors (i.e., couriers, construction, dealerships, last miles delivery and services) with fleet sizes ranging between 25-100 vehicles primarily in the passenger cars &amp; light-medium truck space.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Note - This role is on a remote working set up status and can be based anywhere in Canada.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Accountabilities:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Plan, monitor, and achieve fuel volume growth targets, and the associated margin targets through acquiring new business and growing existing customer share of wallet<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Generate new customer leads and prospects via external networking and a variety of sales tools and strategies<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Develop and maintain long term commercial relationships with key accounts, and external stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Demonstrate exceptional discovery and presentation skills through superior product and services knowledge including experience and confidence with virtual sales<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Maximize profitability of existing Key Accounts through effective use of our customer value propositions, cross business synergies, tactical promotions, and a range of selling techniques<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Drive non-fuel revenue streams; and lead the Shell energy transition and decarbonization agenda for your region<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Keep up to date on relevant competitive offerings, negotiate and confidently overcome objections<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Work collaboratively with other sales team members and third-party partners to meet common objectives and ensuring the highest level of customer satisfaction<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Support our Eastern Global Key Account Manager with a variety of administrative tasks to engage and retain our Francophone accounts<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Demonstrate high interest to respond to customer inquiries with strong analytical skills and attention to details<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Skills &amp;
